Post.title: Webpack 3 Tutorial - HTML Webpack Plugin
Post._content:
`HTML Webpack Plugin` `html`  `app.bundle.js`  `html` 
<!--more-->

##  `HTML Webpack Plugin`

```npm
npm i -D html-webpack-plugin
```

##  `webpack.config.js`

```js
var HtmlWebpackPlugin = require('html-webpack-plugin'); //  html-webpack-plugin
var path = require('path');

module.exports = {
entry: './src/app.js',
output: {

  path: path.resolve(__dirname, 'dist'),
  // the target directory for all output files
  // must be an absolute path (use the Node.js path module)

  filename: 'app.bundle.js'
  // the filename template for entry chunks

},

plugins: [new HtmlWebpackPlugin()] //  html-webpack-plugin

}
```

##  `html`



```npm
npm run dev
```



```npm
npm run prod
```

 `dist`  `index.html` 

![dist  index.html](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/xNq0I-e-92Umpmt2g-040igJwmjMz2eJVLlR1Jd_XkQxLexKuwZvU_nEblxQqB0p7QYT0h2itGoxPKcceHmgBv5GKuq_nBkMq3l6NKkmT0VqEHOMW4GPQYaiT4zqpcLN087QDlaBPawib0kGZjeBLg27UKsunJXDnQy1eDki7ZnZF9v0di0HjzyDfk7u2WKJxjOqXiSr3VpQ_cdjzvdJKMq6P98zrElSPtLqPXbnHghl7knD7l3iAWF_F_m6By0cry24yO06sMowOQgB-4HsWXs0c8R5DP5jsuBh-iSBpsWRZzrlxOSUhzgfY1ZTXlrP9aU1pnh0suleU4RZBmJSp87i_1VXRmrGoNOsuDDB83HXshrWQ-sWoBdxYRouKh3FjmH0j3ybSAdkBWD5-OYp2d6zqT1f0uXzO2VwnalgNlCe3c_BQAqxSh58SWh2NoMsOIm2o2LMJY5-sNsdxgLW6yWBC04s7uveApgKJHxtY3skp_dkbc2xKCoWcDM4Qfy_s9dvTxMfIL6J7RwJrHePbnV4dxBFKhZzaNf44kQS6-v1piVWw1IrL143BZ_qp5HbhgFXgkkWuie5ufplKW9d-Q0SU6MQDGo_QYvX4DzPEoahbmVgl7rjISCm0OpSlkos6LYURLBUG0evIgmvYfXvFbBBk3NaMNsm=w1024-h698-no "dist/index.html")

##  html templates

 `html` 
 `pug` 
 `HTML Webpack Plugin` 


1.  `webpack.config.js`

```js
module.exports = {
  ...
  plugins: [
    new HtmlWebpackPlugin({
      title: 'Custom template', //  html 
      template: './src/index.html' // 
    })
  ]
  ...
}
```

2.  `html` 

 `src`  `index.html`
`<%= htmlWebpackPlugin.options.title %>`  `webpack.config.js` 

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <meta http-equiv="Content-type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8"/>
    <title><%= htmlWebpackPlugin.options.title %></title>
  </head>
  <body>
  </body>
</html>
```

3.  `html`



```npm
npm run dev
```



```npm
npm run prod
```

#  Webpack ?

`Webpack` `html`, `css`, `js`, `sass`, `pug`, `babel`, ... etc. `webpack` assets,`Babel`, `ES6`
<!--more-->

## 

1.  [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/en/)

2.  `npm` 

```npm
npm init
```
 package.json

```js
{
  "name": "Your Project Name",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "Webpack project.",
  "main": "index.js",
  "scripts": {
    "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1",
  },
  "author": "Your Name",
  "license": "ISC",
}
```

3.  Webpack
(global)

```npm
npm -g i webpack
```
> `webpack`global



```npm
npm i -D webpack
```

## 

 src  dist 

* src: 
* dist: `webpack` 
* src/app.js:  `js`  `webpack` 

app.js  console 

```js
console.log('Hello World!');
```

## 

1. `webpack.config.js`

```js
module.exports = {
  entry: './src/app.js',
  output: {
    filename: './dist/app.bundle.js'
  },
}
```

* entry: 
* output: 
  - filename: 

2. `package.json` `scripts`

```js
{
  ...
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "webpack -d --watch",
    "prod": "webpack -p"
  },
  ...
}
```

* -d:  minify js
* --watch: 
* -p:  minify js

##  webpack 

1. `package.json``script` dev

```npm
npm run dev
```

-  `dist` `app.bundle.js` minify

2. `package.json``script` prod

```npm
npm run prod
```

-  `dist` `app.bundle.js` minify

Post.title: Webpack 3 Tutorial - add PUG templates to write html
Post._content:
`pug-loader` `PUG`  `html`
<!--more-->

##  `pug-loader`

```npm
npm i -D pug pug-loader
```

##  `webpack.config.js`

```js
......

module.exports = {
  ......
  module: {
    rules: [
      ......
      {
        test: /\.pug$/,
        use: 'pug-loader'
      }
    ]
  },
  ......
}
```

##  `index.pug`

 `index.html`  `index.pug` `Pug` 

```pug
doctype html
html(lang="en")
  head
    title= pageTitle
    script(type='text/javascript').
      if (foo) bar(1 + 5)
  body
    h1 Pug - node template engine
    #container.col
      if youAreUsingPug
        p You are amazing
      else
        p Get on it!
      p.
        Pug is a terse and simple templating language with a
        strong focus on performance and powerful features.
```

 `webpack.config.js` plugin  `HtmlWebpackPlugin`  `Pug` 

```js
module.exports = {
  ......
  plugins: [
    new HtmlWebpackPlugin({
      template: './src/index.pug'
    }),
    ......
  ]
}
```
